title: Differences in anti-obesity effects between raw and ripened Pu-erh tea polyphenols: impact on gut microbiota enterotypes.
abstract: Pu-erh tea, a dark tea from China, is classified into raw and ripened types. Both have significant anti-obesity effects. Polyphenols are among their major bioactive components. This study aimed to explore the anti-obesity properties and mechanisms of raw (R-TP) and ripened (F-TP) Pu-erh tea polyphenols.
journal: Journal of the science of food and agriculture
